description: StarLink corn recall over allergenicity concern
LL601 GM rice contamination of exports
Brazil nut allergen transferred into soy (not commercialized)
Glyphosate herbicide debate (IARC Group 2A)
Syngenta Bt10 GM maize mislabeled as Bt11; EU required testing of US corn gluten feed and brewersâ€™ grain
China rejected U.S. corn shipments containing MIR162 (Viptera), causing trade disruptions
Unapproved GM wheat (MON71800) detected in Oregon; Japan and South Korea temporarily suspended imports
Triffid GM flax detected in EU supply chains; Canadian exports disrupted
Feral GM canola populations with stacked herbicide tolerance found along U.S. roadsides
Feral GM oilseed rape detected near Japanese ports; imported seed spillage and gene flow noted
EU adopted emergency measures to prevent unauthorized GM rice (e.g., Bt63) from China
Off-target dicamba damage widely reported on non-resistant crops; regulatory changes and court vacatur followed
Field-evolved resistance by western corn rootworm to Bt Cry3Bb1 maize documented in the U.S. Midwest
U.S. Supreme Court upheld patents on self-replicating GM seeds in Bowman v. Monsanto
Canadian Supreme Court ruled on GM canola patent infringement in Monsanto Canada Inc. v. Schmeiser
Unapproved GM wheat detected in Alberta; Japan temporarily suspended imports
Spread of glyphosate-resistant weeds reduced effectiveness and increased costs in herbicide-tolerant cropping systems
Field-evolved resistance of pink bollworm to Bt cotton (Cry1Ac/Cry2Ab) reported in India
GM cassava with virus resistance under trials but concerns raised about delayed adoption and food security implications
Approval and commercialization of Bt cowpea in Nigeria faced regional trade and biosafety concerns
GM Amflora potato approved in EU for starch production but faced consumer rejection and was eventually withdrawn
GM sugar beet injunction in the U.S. halted planting temporarily over environmental concerns
